item.title: StrelaStealer: Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee
item.description: Executive Summary StrelaStealer is a Malware Stealer that has been out since 2022. it steals Outlook and Thunderbird credentials. StrelaStealer searches for “logins.json” (account/password) and “key4.db” (password database) within the “%APPDATA%\Thunderbird\Profiles" directory to acquire the credentials for Thunderbird. StrelaStealer seeks out the Windows Registry from where it can retrieve the program’s key and “IMAP User”, “IMAP Server”, as well as the “IMAP Password” values. Since the latter is kept in an encrypted form, the malicious program employs the Windows CryptUnprotectData feature to decrypt it prior to exfiltration.

item.title: PikaBot: Unmasking Its Deep Secrets
item.description: Overview PikaBot is a malware loader, widely distributed since February 2023, that is used by Initial Access Brokers (IABs) to establish an initial foothold within a victimâ€™s networks and to distribute additional payloads such as Cobalt Strike and Meterpreter. Since its emergence in early 2023, PikaBot appears to be in active development, with a new major version released in February 2024. The malware employs advanced anti-analysis techniques to evade detection and harden analysis, including system checks, indirect syscalls, encryption of next-stage and strings, and dynamic API resolving.

item.title: Cmstp UAC Bypass
item.description: Introduction While i was looking for a way to bypass UAC (User Account Control) i came across cmstp.exe which is a LOLBIN (Living of the land binary) that can be abused to bypass UAC and execute arbitrary commands through an auto-elevated COM interface. Abusing CMSTP.EXE Running cmstp.exe with the following config will spawn an elevated cmd.exe. [version] Signature=$chicago$ [DefaultInstall] RunPreSetupCommands=RunPreSetupCommandsSection [RunPreSetupCommandsSection] C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe [Strings] ServiceName="EVIL" ShortSvcName="EVIL" Hurdle: User Options Box The issue is that the user must select All users option then click OK in order to spawn the elevated cmd.
